descriptors.d: Specify the location of the file that you would like to upload
Show a preview of the data
Data can be uploaded from Excel or CSV text files.
Only one sheet from a workbook can be imported.
The preview shows the first 20 rows of data and provides the capability to add Column Headers to the data.
Maximum file size for {0} files is {1} MB.
Your data was imported successfully as {0}.
Create a grid or graph report from scratch or from a template.
Create an enterprise report, scorecard, or dashboard from scratch or from a template.
You can use the imported data later in reports, documents or dashboards. The data will remain in the system indefinitely.
Share this connection with other users
Select a table from the database
Choose an existing database connection or add a new connection by clicking on + button.
Note: When selecting the 'Share this connection with other users' box, this database shared connection can be used by ALL users.
Import data from a database by a. selecting a table or b. writing a SQL Query against the data source.
The preview shows the first 20 rows of data.
Show a preview of the data
A cube with that name already exists. Do you want to overwrite the cube?

MicroStrategy automatically maps all columns from the data source to attributes and metrics.
Change an attribute into a metric, or vice-versa, by using the arrows. Uncheck any columns that should not be imported.
Note: After the Intelligent Cube has been imported, you can later refresh the data by clicking on the Intelligent Cube and repeating the Data Import process.
Select your source to import data from Files, Databases, Salesforce, Hadoop or Web Services.
Delete cube to free up allocated space
Currently using {0} of {1} MB of allocated (In-memory) space.
An object with name '{0}'and type '{1}' already exits in the destination folder.
Error fetching data from the database.
Import an Excel, CSV or Text file
Import data using a script: SQL, XQuery, SOQL, or HiveQL.
There are changes made to the current import that is not saved. Are you sure you want to start a new import?
Duplicate column Aliases are not allowed.
For security reasons, please browse and upload the file before attempting to save and republish the cube
Duplicate column headers are not allowed.
Cannot create connection because the name is in use. Please use a different name.
The connection name can't be empty
"{0}" was uploaded successfully. File processing in progress...
Import from table succeeded. Cube mapping in progress...
Import from SQL succeeded. Cube mapping in progress...
Switching the file type is not allowed during republishing
You do not have write access to this folder. Select a different folder.
Explore data visually and discover trends, patterns, relationships and outliers.
Cube Name is missing. Cannot republish the Cube.
Error saving and publishing the Cube:
Error in importing the selected sheet:
Please map all the ID forms of the selected project attributes:
Unable to fetch DB Instance details to edit.
Error fetching the list of Database Instances:
No DBMS objects were fetched. You cannot create a Database Instance.
Please check if the URL is correct and check MicroStrategy Web Error Log.
The DB Instance XML is empty.
Unable to save the database instance
File I/O Error. Please check the permissions of the file and try again.
The source information for this cube was not fetched:
The bootstrap sequence has failed. See the Error Log for details.
Attribute form {0} of attribute {1} has not been mapped
Preview shows only first 50 rows of data
Some previously uploaded columns are missing.
You can now connect to Salesforce.com
Click Next below to sign in to Salesforce.com.
MicroStrategy does not request or store your Salesforce credentials.
Sign in to Salesforce.com Select your report Create a visualization
You do not have sufficient privileges on the report {0}. Contact your Salesforce administrator.

The Salesforce report {0} requires user input and cannot be uploaded. If you wish to use data from this report, save a copy of the report that does not require user input in Salesforce.com and try this process again.
Cannot upload data because the Salesforce report {0} has not been saved. Save the report and try again.
The report {0} can no longer be edited or run. Your Salesforce administrator has disabled all reports for the custom object, or its relationships have changed.
An unexpected error has occurred while uploading a Salesforce report {0}.
Error converting the data type of the cell in row {0} and column {1} with the value {2}.
Error fetching the list of reports from the external source
Unexpected error while passing session information to back end
Update existing data and add new data
Keep existing data and add new data
Type multi-pass SQL or double-click a table name...

Use one of the following URL formats to upload your file: File://, Http://, Https://, Ftp://
'File://' format allows you to upload files in your local machine. For example: File://ComputerName/path/FileName.
Some other examples are: http://host/path/FileName https://user:password@host/path/FileName ftp://user:password@host/path/FileName ftp://user:password@host:port/path/FileName
Data can be in tabular or crosstab format.

This column contains geographical locations.
Additional columns will be created automatically so
that you can view your data on maps.
See menu options for details.
This column contains date values.\nAdditional columns will be created automatically.\nSee menu options for details.
The following previously uploaded column is missing:{0}If you publish without this column, existing reports, documents and dashboards might be affected.
Mapping this column to a project attribute will remove all related derived date/time attributes. Do you want to continue?
The following previously uploaded columns are missing:{0}If you publish without these columns, existing reports, documents and dashboards might be affected.
Mapping this column to a project attribute will remove its geographical role and any derived attributes. Do you want to continue?
Tabular representation of the crosstabbed data
Switch back to crosstabbed representation of the data
Available tables cache was created at {0} GMT. Click Refresh to get the latest tables and update the cache.
Contact your administrator to configure access to Salesforce reports by enabling an https connection and setting the appropriate Salesforce parameters. See Help for more details.
URL not valid, file could not be imported.
There are no columns to import.
The selected source is not found.
Show a preview of the report
An object with this name already exists. Please choose another name.
Incremental refresh of an existing cube via new import is not supported (you can run the original cube to update or insert new data). Do you want to overwrite this cube with the newly imported data?
Cube name cannot contain the following characters: " \ [ ]
Ensure that it's a Select statement that returns data.
Unable to save because a database connection called "{0}" already exists.
To run a SQL, first select a database connection.
Unable to fetch data. Importing files using {0} has been disabled by the administrator.
We do not support the URL protocol you provided.
URL file uploads are currently disabled. Please contact your administrator.
Use one of the following URL formats to upload your file:
'File://' format allows you to upload files in your local machine. For example: File://ComputerName/path/FileName.
The import process cannot proceed with an empty file.
Please select what you would like to do with the data now.
Below is the tabular view of your crosstabbed data
Please select a geography role for this attribute and any additional attributes that you want to create
Please select additional time attributes that you want to create
All other Forms of the Attribute will be unlinked too. Would you like to continue?
"{0}" cannot be linked to Attribute "{1}" because they have incompatible data types.
